Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, but too far out. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: spreekitik
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights and got what I paid for. the bed was ok, the room was the right size. the aircon was working perfectly. it is very quiet and you can really have a good night's rest. cons: the shower area was too small. hotel was way out of town (not even in Rome!) -18mins by regional train; around 40 mins from termini station. Party tip: If you're going back late at night, you should check the regional train schedule. Last trains are 22:50 on weekdays and Saturday, 22:10 on Sundays. You can hire a taxi from Rome but it'll cost you ~20 EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at this dive- it isn't even in Rome”
Reviews.Author: holidayarris
Reviews.Content: Seriously, I booked this as part of a package and was aware it was 'a little' way out of the city but not this far! If you are landing at the airport anytime after 8pm you still have to take a taxi from Terminus rail station to the hotel. The taxi cost us 70Euros and throughout the journey the driver kept on saying to us 'why are you staying here- it isn't even in Rome! The hotel itself was horrible and I don't consider myself to be fussy. The room smelt of damp with a creaking old mattress, I didn’t find the people friendly at all (unlike some on this forum) and the breakfast was something you would expect to find in a backpackers hostel! We stayed one night and immediately found another hotel that was central and we were happy to stay in. Awful waste of time and money staying there and suggest others don’t make the same mistake

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff but not so nicer hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMandy
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my cousin on a girls city break to Rome from London- we ended up checking into the hotel very late and the first room we were shown too the bed's weren't made and the toilet was very dirty. We went back down to reception and he showed us a 'nicer suite room', which was a lot larger and had a jacuzzi bath in, but then again the room was dirty and there was underwear on the bathroom floor. We told the receptionist again and he managed to find us another room, that he checked before we went it. The bed in this room was made and the facilities clean, small but clean. The older italian man at the reception desk the next morning was very helpful in showing us how to get to the train station, what to see in the few days we had there and where to get proper italian gelato. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the train station, however you do have to cross quiet a busy road, so if taking children be a bit more careful about it. Trains into Rome are very frequent too - we never had to wait more than 5-7 minutes for one (and a lot cheaper than London). Except for the bedroom mix up in the morning everything else was fine, the staff were extremely friendly- also a few cute backpackers there too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for people on a budget”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to find a decent place to lay your head for the night and wash up this place works. You definitely won't be traveling to Rome just for Hotel Flaminius. Its only about a 15 minute train ride from Piazza del Popolo. From Piazza del Popolo you have walkable access to the sights of Rome or you can get the Metro from there also. The Hotel is in a dirty, sketchy sort of neighborhood. We never felt uncomfortable being there but we spent very little time there also... to sleep and wash up only. The hotel has a friendly enough staff, average breakfast, and average rooms w/ Air Conditioning and a Washroom. It does get loud at times because it is right next to the train line and a road that is busy at times. The Hotel is kept clean but has a musty smell to it. We found the best restaurant a short walk away. Le Vere Grotte (http://www.leveregrotte.com/) had a great menu, friendly service and a wicked outdoor patio... this was easily the best food we had, by far, during our stay in Rome. All in all Flaminius was fine for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “ok but if you can go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: claire14671
Reviews.Content: Staff were really friendly, rooms were clean, but if you look on the official website for this hotel it states there is a restaurant and 24hr bar, there were neither, so when you get back to the hotel after a day in the city there is nothing to do, the area surrounding the hotel is terrible, really rundown, the locals aren't that friendly either, the manager was lovely and really helpful though, another plus side is that it only costs 1 euro by train to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location specially for families”
Reviews.Author: jccj613
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms here. we have no complaints about the service or the amenities except that the lift was very small. However the location is not at all suitable for families with kids particularly if you are using public transport.. From the centre of town we have to take a suburban train (the website says tram ride which is also deceptive because it makes one think of a trams which normally run inside the city). The train is in bad shape and runs both slowly and the frequency is not good at all. it took us almost 1 1/2 hrs to reach the hotel from the Rome termini to the hotel. we arrived at a very deserted, dilapidated and graffiti ridden station.. didn't like the location at all and were really worried about coming back to the hotel in the dark. this fear was heightened when we wanted to get back into town. the receptionist told us that the station we arrived at would not have a ticket machine and we would have to walk to the next staion. that walk was scary as we again walked through an overgrown deserted path and came across 3 sets of drunks.And this was at 1 pm. This station too was dilapidated and when we identified the ticket machine from a large metal box with no markings left on it we could not read any instructions we just put our money into the slot and prayed we would get a ticket. fortunately we did. Reached rome and after grabbing a quick bite immediately looked for and booked a nice hotel at the same rate right next to the Termini. even though we had paid up fully for our rooms at the flaminus and with no idea whether we would get a refund, we checked out. On the positive side, of the 5 different hotels we stayed in in France and italy this one offered the best Continental breakfast with, as they say on their website, fresh baked croissants.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better places to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Zingle Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, and would have moved if I had not pre-paid for my room. While I was out, the room cleaner opened my bedroom window. There was a huge storm, and the rain poured in all over my suitcase. My clothes and shoes were soaked...luckily books and electronics were only a little damp. To allow everything to dry, I had to totally unpack my suitcase and spread my things on every available dry space. The young man on reception managed to find a room where he could hang my clothes. The next morning, I requested another room, as the carpet was soaked, and I was down-graded to a very small room. My suitcase was still wet, so I had to move everything in small armloads. Obviously, it took for ever. Never once did anyone apologize for the inconvenience all this had caused. I was unable to obtain an email address for the manager, and I was under the impression that he would have been totally indifferent to my situation.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd Visit To Hotel Flaminius”
Reviews.Author: UsaTraveler20
Reviews.Content: True to my word my wife and I did stay here again. It was for 10 days during the first two weeks of July, 2010. We find Hotel Flaminius to be economical with a very easy and inexpensive train ride to Piazza del Popolo / Metro. The train is still 1 euro and it takes only 18 minutes to arrive at the center of Rome where you can walk to many of the famous sites. You can also grab the Metro right there at Piazza del Popolo for the same 1 euro because the ticket is good for 75 minutes. Our rooms were clean, well kept daily, the beds were fine and the included breakfast is satisfying. The air conditioning was great and we certainly needed it during our trip. During this visit I noticed more guests and it appears that they have been successful at bringing more tour groups who are passing through or going to Rome. Fabio, the day manager, was very helpful as were the other hotel workers. They have Internet access in the lobby which we used. My only suggestion would be for them to upgrade the computer and monitor to a more current system. The room television has many stations but only one English speaking channel (the BBC). I was hoping for CNN. Maybe next time. In Rome I would like to recomend that you visit the museum called Villa Borghese. It's wonderful. Also, I recomend that in order to avoid real long lines that you book tours in advance via the Internet (for example, the Vatican Museum tour). We look forward to our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is ok but if you can afford go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: lebada
Reviews.Content: I visited Roma in the end of Octomber with my wife and my sister and her husband. We chose this hotel and bookend on the internet as it was the best offer we could get and reading the other visitors review we thought would be ok. Hotel is not bad, staff is really friendly but I think is little bit to far from town and waist a lot of time to get there. Good thing is that it is really close to the train station that take you to Flaminiu Metro Station and from there to Termini Metro Station . Breakfeast ..well many said it is great but i think is poor. Only some meat and cereals ....no fruits no vegetables, maybe it was better before the crisis but not now...not enough choices, nothing warm for example some bacon, ham, egs nothing...in rest prettty clean and not too noisy.Hallora!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay if you arrive early enough in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LondonClaire80
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel was great and we were both pleasantly surprised. However, if you arrive to Rome airport after about 6pm you will struggle to find transport to get you there and will end up (as we did because we arrived at 9pm) paying 65euro for a taxi. If you get in early enough, catch the train to Termini, then Metro line A to Flaminius and then the train to La Celsa and it is about 3min walk down the hill to the hotel (right out of the station). Once you are there, it only actually takes about 20min to get into Rome city centre and is really easily accessible with trains coming every 10mins. It does kind of feel like the 'ghetto' due to all the graffitti but we are two girls and we never once felt unsafe or insecure about the area. Would definately return now that I know the above information.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel- Shame about the local area”
Reviews.Author: Skellig86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Flaminius because a friend was getting married in a villa on the other side of Prima Porta. The hotel itself was very nice, the room was clean and a good size, also with a fridge which was very handy. The rooms are also airconditioned which is essential in Rome in August as it was 40 degrees most days and very humid! All the staff I dealt with were very polite and helpful. The hotel is a little outside Rome but it is only 200m to the train station, the trains run frequently and take 20 minutes to get into Flaminio Station, from which its very easy to get to all the tourist spots, also the train is only 1 euro per trip, but make sure you buy the ticket before you leave the hotel and be sure to validate it on the train or you will get fined! There are maps of rome and instructions on how to use public transport in the hotel lobby which we found very helpful. Overall the only thing I wasnt happy with is Prima Porta, the town where the hotel is- It's horrible. Everything is covered in graffitti, nothing seems to ever be open. We were stared at everywhere we went and there seems to be inumerable groups of men hanging around all the time which I found very intimidating. It's not a huge issue since you don't really need to go to Prima Porta for anything except the mini-mart (La Celsa Station is on the other side of the hotel) but just be prepared to spend all your time in central rome since there is nothing locally.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: adrianyyz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, because the rate was exceptionally good compared to everything else we found, and also included a complimentary breakfast, and easy access to the metro. We also wished to stay outside of the city centre. It was in a very quiet neighbourhood. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Nothing fancy here, and perhaps a little dated, but the staff was very friendly and the breakfast was good. Room was small, but what you would expect for Europe, and included a balcony. VERY easy access to the metro, and a short 20 minute ride into the centre. Would highly recommend this hotel for the budget conscious traveller, and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lale1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It was very easy to get to from Flaminio Station. The nearest station to the hotel was La Celsa which was 20 minutes on the train but you do have to ring the bell for it to stop or it goes to the next stop but not alot of difference in the distance to the hotel. The hotel seemed a little "tired" but it was comfortable. In our room it seemed to need a bit of an update - Room 305, one of the walls was dirty but the bathroom was spotless, plenty of toilet roll and toiletries. The room was right next door to the lift and was quite noisy until about midnight! AUnfortunately there was nothing to eat in the evening but you could get a drink from the bar and sit in reception where there are comfy sofas. Internet was 1.50 euro for half an hour. There was a snack machine down here as well. The trains start running at 6.30am and there is a main road by the side. Breakfast was excellent - plenty of coffee, croissants, rolls, cheese, hams, yoghurts, fruit. It was not the best hotel I have stayed in but it was comfortable and easy to get to Rome from. The reception staff I found very helpful indeed.

Reviews.Title: “dont go there service crap”
Reviews.Author: lindill2001
Reviews.Content: Male staff not at all helpful. The hotel is out of the way from anywhere there was nothing to do or see from the hotel. The restaurant if they have one was not open . You needed a train ticket to get to centre Rome which only hotel had and they had no change for a 10 euro note(disgusting in my opinion) So we had to walk a long way to find a shop to get change then further to get next station. Hotel room was on 3rd floor. the life only accommodates 2 people so if you have luggage have to do it in 2 gos. The staIrways are dangerous, the handrails are coming away from the wall. No toilet rolls in room, Cleaners did not leave any. Embarrasing to have to ask for it. The choice for breakfast was very very limited. I expected much more. The bed was very very uncomfortable mattress sank when you lied in it and stayed like it. WOULD NEVER GO THERE AGAIN MOST UNFRIENDLY HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN AND I HAVE TRAVELLED THE WORLD. Having said this ROME is a smashing place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: InSaNe_CaSs
Reviews.Content: On my next trip to Rome I will be staying here again! I loved our room - top storey which over looked the neighbourhood. The bed was super comfy, there was a fridge, great bathroom which looked brand new! Breakfast every morning was fresh and tasty - great way to start a fun filled busy day. Was a little confused as to where the train station was but once we figured it out it became second nature. The staff were super friendly which always help. They have their own computer with internet access which is great.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay at Hotel Flaminius”
Reviews.Author: UsaTraveler20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned to the US from Rome where we stayed at Hotel Flaminius for 10 days. We stayed there because I had been to Rome last November for a brief visit and enjoyed my stay at this hotel. We found the staff to be cordial and helpful. The room was large, clean, well kept, air-conditioned and had a balcony. We had a good breakfast each morning. Internet service is available. The hotel Director, Mr. Stefano, and also Ms. Cristina were especially helpful with providing directions to some tourist sites in Rome. The train to Rome is still 1 euro and takes about 18 minutes to Piazza del Popolo/Metro. From there you can walk to the various sites, transfer to the Metro system, or take a taxi. We would definitely stay there again. J.S.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: Raewyn21
Reviews.Content: We only had one night here, but that was more than enough. Very damp, smelly room, shower head spraying straight out of bathroom into the bedroom was the cause of the smell..The sodden carpet had caused damp up the walls of the room to about 9inches, with the plaster falling off. We stayed in annexe next to hotel, accessed by a tunnel under the road. However the staff were very pleasant & courtious.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there”
Reviews.Author: poni64
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and that is all ok with flaminius hotel.The room are dirty with a bad smell , the breakfast is like in prison and is not a good idea to eat there. Don't go there , it's a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there unless you really need to!”
Reviews.Author: Donna12203
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Flaminius hotel in December 2006 only for a night. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel, unless you don’t have any other option. It is outside the city and it takes 30 minutes to get there from Flaminio metro station. Then it’s a 5 minutes walk in the middle of the highway. The hotel is located in the middle of the highway and you can hear the cars passing by. The facilities are old and the bathroom is even worse! When you turn on the light there is this loud fan that also gets on. The toilet is very old and I question its cleanliness. We couldn’t take a shower with the faucet open because the drain clogs and the water overflows. The breakfast is horrible!!! There were only industrial pastries and juice (water with sugar and colorants). The cleaning lady serves the coffee during breakfast. The explanation given by other reviewers of how to get there is perfect. The train that takes you there from Rome is beyond filthy and during the night you have to watch out because the train stops don’t have proper lighting and the signs with the name of the stops are all full with graffiti making it impossible to read where you are. We paid 100€ for the night, way more than the other hotel we were staying in the previous days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel ”
Reviews.Author: Liyong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Flaminius Hotel Rome for three days in mid-July. The hotel is simple and clean. The staff were very friendly and all spoke good English. Our room (triple) was spacious. Although the hotel is located near a freeway and train track, it is very quiet at night after the last train at about 11pm. The best thing about Flaminius Hotel is its whisper-quite air conditioning unit which has a digital remote control allowing you to set the exact desired room temperature. The breakfast room is large and has about 10 tables. Breakfast started at 7am and included croissant, bread, cake, cereals, milk, coffee, juices, and even some tomato slices and green beans. The hotel’s location is outside city of Rome but is on a commuter train route. From the Fiumicino Airport, you can take an express train to Termini (9.5-euro) and then change to Metro (1-euro) from Termini to Flaminio. Exit the Flaminio Metro station and get to the commuter train station next to it. The same 1-euro Metro ticket is good for the commuter train ride from Flaminio to La Celsa (about 10 train stops). After you get off the train stop, cross the street and walk in the same direction as the train on Via Frassineto for about 200 meters to the Hotel. Make sure you get off the train at La Celsa stop, not Prima Porta stop even though both stops are about 200m from the hotel. From the Fiumicino Airport you can also take the local train (5-euro) to Ostiense station and change to Metro Station Piramide (a short 5 minute walk with escalator). For a 1-euro Metro ticket, you can go from Piramide to Termini on Line B and change to Line A from Termini to Flaminio. Then exit Metro station at Flaminio to take the commuter train next door with the same Metro ticket. Ride on the commuter train for 10 stops until you reach La Celsa station. The airport express train will probably save you about 15 minutes. You can buy tickets for the airport train and Metro inside the airport train station and validate the Metro ticket later at a Metro station. It will take about 1 hour 10 minutes from the airport to Flaminius station. It will take another 30 minutes from Flaminius station to the hotel (5-10min waiting, 15min train ride, 5min walking). If you arrive at the Ciampino Airport, you can take a regional train first to Termini and then change to Metro to Flaminius and then to the commuter train to the hotel at La Celsa station. Another option is to take a bus to the nearby Metro Anagnina Station and then from Anagnina to Flaminius and change to commuter train from Flaminius to La Celsa. The same 1-euro Metro ticket will take care all the way. If you drive, the hotel has some limited parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay alot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came to rome for a summer holiday for 6 days as part of my euro trip which inclused germany and amsterdam as i stayed 5 days in rome by my self from the 17th of june to the 22nd ..... so naturaly i had worried about some problems like knowing places and attractions to go to,,and places to shop,,and even trasportation within the city itself ..but luckily the hotel staff here made it more than easy for me ..they gave me a map with all the places i wanted to go..informed me of all methods of tansportation within the city at the diffrent hours of the day...and even booked me the plane tickets i needed to go to amsterdam!!!....so truth be told the staff have made it a very conveniet stay for me

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Flaminius Hotel from 13th till 18th of May. Since i arrived i had some trouble with my dad. From the first till the last evening they were very helpfull, generous & understanding....for me they were a great support when i needed it!!!! I can recommend the hotel to everybody...Thankx guys for everything...

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful stay”
Reviews.Author: Raymond S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a double room at the Flaminius over Easter from the 13th - 18th April 2006. It was also my wife's Birthday celebration. On arrival we were allocated a room which, when we entered, had not been cleaned from the previous occupants. We were though allocated another room. This room did not have a hair dryer or a plug for the wash hand basin. These discrepancies were put right immediately. The air conditioning and the lighting above the dressing table did not seem to be connected to the electric supply as they were inoperative. On arriving at breakfast most mornings there was often little left. It was left to guests to point out that the orange juice had run out and that more bread etc was needed. Special effort had to be made to ensure a cup of coffee. On the Monday there was no cereal or bread left on the table and we were told that no more was available There was 'something' wrong with the water system which produced a noise which alternated between a low hum and a high pitched wail. This meant that each night it was impossible to sleep. It was not until the last night that we were offered another room. We took on holiday a travel kettle and the cups belonging to this were removed from the room. Although reported these were never found. The description of the hotel speaks of a balcony. There was certainly no balcony to our room. Both my wife and I were very disappointed with the hotel facilities and services and would not advise anyone to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed stay at hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing stay at the hotel 28th October to 1st November 2005. Poor breakfast facilities and very disappointed with standard of accomodation, though staff friendly MR. Leslie Pounder

HotelInfo.Name: Flaminius Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Frassineto 21-23, 00188 Rome, Italy
